sub_title: Retail Pricing Team Lead at KLM Royal Dutch Airlines
summary:
I am an outgoing, social person with a strong interest in international business, something which is mirrored in my international experiences. I love to think along with the organization's needs with a problem-solving mind-set and an eye on continuous improvement possibilities.
With the ever growing globalization, I believe that being adaptable and open to different cultures is becoming an important asset in any organisation. Furthermore, I always aim to exceed expectations, so whatever the challenge, I am willing to embrace it with an ambitious and positive attitude!

projects.title: Inspire2Care Event
projects.description: On June 7th 2015, Inspire2Care organized its first independent event, which included 30 stalls and numerous children’s activities. Being one of the two contact persons and the main coordinator of the event, I was highly involved during the first stages of planning up until the cleaning after the event. This event helped increase the organization’s image, awareness, and donations.

profile_positions.description:
As Team Lead at KLM, your role encompasses a range of tasks and responsibilities aimed at ensuring the daily competitiveness of the North Atlantic Joint Venture (AF/KL/DL/VS) for all flows from Europe to US, CA, MX, PF. I also actively contribute to Agile implementation, drive projects for process improvement, and provide support for the personal development of team members throughout their careers at KLM. Here is a summary of your key tasks and responsibilities:

1.	Operational Team Management:
•	I have operational responsibility for a team of six Competitive Pricing Analysts. It is my duty to oversee their work and ensure that the North Atlantic Joint Venture (AF/KL/DL/VS) maintains daily competitiveness for all flows from Europe to US, CA, MX, PF.

2.	Agile Facilitation:
•	I actively assist the team in working Agile. In addition to my role as a product owner, I provide guidance and support to help the team understand and implement Agile practices effectively tailored to the needs of our department.

3.	Project Management:
•	I am actively involved in various projects aimed at improving efficiency, promoting alignment between teams, and driving process improvements. These projects contribute to enhancing the overall effectiveness and success of our department.

4.	Personal Development Support:
•	A significant aspect of my facilitating role is designing and supporting the personal development of team members. From the moment they join KLM until they are ready to take the next step in their careers, I am dedicated to guiding and mentoring them, helping them grow and progress professionally.
profile_positions.title: Retail Pricing Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
As a Competitive Pricing Analyst at KLM, my primary responsibility was to ensure the day-to-day competitiveness of the North Atlantic Joint Venture (AF/KL/DL/VS) for all routes from Europe to the US, CA, MX, PF. My responsibilities were on the Dutch, German, Nordics and BeLu market. I conducted competitive analyses, ensured accurate fare distribution, and actively participated in projects to improve cooperation and coordination within the team
Here is a summary of my tasks and responsibilities:

1.	Retail Pricing:
•	I played a vital role in maintaining the daily price competitiveness by conducting thorough competitive analysis on fares, rules, and conditions. If necessary, I took prompt action aligned with the pricing strategy.
•	I developed analyses and reports to monitor market dynamics and trends, providing valuable insights for decision-making regarding pricing strategy.

2.	Fare Distribution:
•	I held the responsibility for ensuring the accurate and timely entry and distribution of fares in the reservation system (ATPCO). This ensured that competitive fares are available to customers.

3.	Scrum Master:
•	I acted as a Scrum Master, facilitating effective collaboration and agile project management within our team.

In addition to my daily tasks, I also took part in various projects aimed at improving and optimizing pricing processes. My additional tasks and responsibilities included:

1.	YR-Coordinator:
•	I coordinated YR-Requests (special fare requests) with different departments within and outside KLM, ensuring seamless communication and efficient execution.

2.	Improving Cooperation:
•	I actively worked to enhance cooperation between the Team Manager, Team Leads, and Analysts, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.

3.	WNS Coordinator:
•	I took on the role of WNS Coordinator, overseeing and coordinating tasks related to our airline's partnership with WNS, a global business process management company.
profile_positions.title: Competitive (Retail) Pricing Analyst

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a Business Developer, I had the opportunity to contribute to the organization's growth, profitability, and customer satisfaction by successfully leading projects, managing customer success, providing reporting and administration support, and organizing training and seminars. Here is a summary of my key tasks and responsibilities:

1.	Project Management:
•	Spearheaded the evaluation of sales performance for the international Business Development team, driving improvements and identifying growth opportunities.
•	Led the international Customer Satisfaction Survey, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of customer needs and enhancing overall satisfaction.
•	Established standards focused on efficiency and profitability gains, such as developing profitable business cases, transforming databases, and creating reporting templates.

2.	Customer Success Management:
•	Acted as the Customer Success Manager for our IT solution, playing a crucial role in its development, adoption, and continuous improvement.
•	Supported account managers throughout Europe at every stage of the sales funnel, providing guidance and assistance to drive successful customer engagements.

3.	Reporting and Administration:
•	Provided various Management Information (MI) and reporting services, delivering valuable insights to support decision-making processes and business strategy.
•	Served as the Salesforce Administrator, ensuring the smooth functioning and optimization of the CRM system.

4.	Training and Seminars:
•	Conducted internal and external training sessions, sharing my expertise and knowledge to enhance team members' skills and capabilities.
•	Organized seminars, facilitating knowledge exchange and networking opportunities among industry professionals.
profile_positions.title: International Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
As a project coordinator I was responsible for the coordination of all the maintenance to the public lighting in the Port of Rotterdam, within strict deadlines. During this project I have been the middleman between different stakeholders, incl. the project manager, the client, engineers, and third parties. Other tasks included: analyzing operational and financial progress, daily responsibility over a team of 6-8 engineers, implementation of new work processes, and overall continuous improvements.
•	Analyzing operational and financial progress.
•	Data-driven process optimizations.
•	Taking the lead in the implementation of iPads.
•	Writing manuals and processes and providing training.
•	Coordinating projects repairs within tight deadlines (24 or 48 hours).
•	Close communication with the client
•	Handling the invoice process.
profile_positions.title: Project Planner Public Lighting Department

profile_positions.description:
•	Digitalization and continuous improvements of work processes. 
•	Providing daily support to the engineers.
•	Analyse and report progress.
•	Proper registration of all failures of the public lighting in the Port of Rotterdam.
•	Mutating and verifying data in multiple databases.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Position at the Public Lighting Department

profile_positions.description:
•	Tasked with solving the backlog.
•	Assisting the department’s digitalization process. 
•	Mutating and verifying sensitive information/data in multiple databases.
profile_positions.title: Temporary Postition: Supporting HR Department

profile_positions.description:
Title: ‘AkzoNobel’s Trend Analysis for the Refinish Market in the United States.’
Goal: To analyse the trends in Customer Base and Product Sales in the Refinish Market in the United States.
Result: My thesis disproved a key assumption on AkzoNobel's sales planning which was based on the market reports but not supported by sales trends.
profile_positions.title: Graduation Internship

profile_positions.description:
Assisting the Talent Management Department and Assisting the US-Market Team.

Tasks included: 
For the Talent Management Department:

-	Market Research 
-	Online recruiting of freelancers in different countries
-	Created freelancer forms (Spotzer website didn’t work anymore)
-	Create bi-weekly reports for several departments
-	Create an overview of freelancers using Salesforce
-	Creating Report of the change in Freelancer roles June 2012 to November 2012 and compare. 
-	Training new Intern

For the Marketing Department (US Market-team): 

-       Eliminating backlog.
-	Assist with creating an online media campaigns for small and medium sized businesses in the US.
-	Assist with creating mobile websites for small and medium sized businesses in the US.
-	Assist other departments and learning about the SEO rules
-	Assigning certain tasks to Studio department through SalesForce
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description:

Contacting potential customers in Western Europe, mainly the Netherlands.
Maintaining relationship with those customers.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager Internship

volunteer_experiences.description:
In order to make a change in the World, team Inspire2Care aims to inspire others to care for the less fortunate. The Inspire2Care team believes that anyone can make a change in the world. We believe that change comes from within each person. To inspire everyone that they can be the change they want to see in the world, I2C was formed. 

As part of the management team, I have been involved as an volunteer at I2C stalls at different events. I had various tasks across different departments, such as:
•	Creating organizational structure.
•	Creating marketing tools in order to generate donations.
•	In charge of recruitments.
•	In charge of operations
•	Taking the lead during various events. 

•	In 2013, I have been involved in developing the first international project at Inspire2Care. During this two-week project, we donated several necessary items for a blood bank, a retirement home, and an orphanage. 
•	In 2014, I have been involved in developing the second international project at Inspire2Care, which focused on elementary schools and medical camps. At the schools, several workshops were given focusing on the importance of basic hygiene, a clean environment and professions. At the medical camps, free health clinics were provided for the local villagers. 
•	In 2015, Inspire2Care organized its first independent event, which included 30 stalls and numerous children’s activities. Being one of the two contact persons and the main coordinator, I was highly involved during the first stages of planning until the cleaning after the event. This event helped increase the organization’s image, experience, and funds.
